document.docAuthor: Chani-Posse, Mariana, Newton, Alfred F., Hansen, Aslak Kappel & Solodovnikov, Alexey
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist and taxonomic changes for Central and South American Philonthina (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist and taxonomic changes for Central and South American Philonthina (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae)

bibRefCitation.refString: Fauvel, A. (1874) Faune Gallo-Rhenane ou description des insectes qui habitent la France, la Belgique, la Hollande, les provinces Rhenanes et le Valais, avec tableaux synoptiques et planches gravees (suite). Bulletin de la Societe Linneenne de Normandie, Series 2, 8, 167 - 318, pls. 1 - 2.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hesperus
Fauvel 1874 : 200
. Type species:
Staphylinus rufipennis Gravenhorst 1802
, designated by
Lucas (1920: 324)
.

=
Onthostygnus
Sharp 1884 : 392
. Type species:
Onthostygnus fasciatus Sharp, 1884
, designated by virtual monotypy (second species described in 1885). Note: as new synonym of
Hesperus
Navarrete-Heredia et al. (2002
: 338
)
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes: Among the 209 valid species currently known for the globally distributed genus
Hesperus
, only 10 of them have been recorded from the Neotropical region. Eight of these species were cited from South America and never revised after their original description. As it happens with other species-rich genera of Philonthina , there is broad consensus on the non-monophyly of
Hesperus
( Schillhammer 2002 , 2016 ; Li & Zhou 2011 ; Chani- Posse 2014a ). Furthermore, the so-called
Hesperus
complex appears to be a rather basal group of Philonthina , far from the Neotropical lineage (
Chani-Posse et al. 2018
). The current concept of the genus is that of Smetana (1995: 489) .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hesperus argentinus
Scheerpeltz 1971a : 191
. Type locality: Santiago del Estero . Type depository: NMW ( Scheerpeltz ) #? ST. Distribution : Argentina
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comment. Not
Hesperus
, to be placed in a further study; it probably belongs to the
Belonuchus
complex.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hesperus bruchi
Bernhauer 1921c : 169
. Type locality: Santiago d. Estero prov., Argentina. Type depository: FMNH HT. Distribution: Argentina. Notes: with
Acromyrmex lundi
( Bruch 1929 ; Navarrete-Heredia 2001 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comment. Not
Hesperus
, to be placed in a further study; it probably belongs to the
Belonuchus
complex.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hesperus fasciatus ( Sharp 1884 )
Onthostygnus fasciatus
Sharp 1884 : 392
. Type locality: Xalapa, Veracruz. Type depository: BMNH #? ST.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution:
Mexico
. Notes: comb. nov. ex
Onthostygnus (
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
: 339)
; distribution

within Mexico (
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
, Márquez 2006 ); Hidalgo, in
Tillandsia
( Bromeliaceae ) (
Hornung-Leoni et al. 2013
).

bibRefCitation.refString: Bernhauer, M. (1925) 30. Beitrag zur Staphylinidenfauna Sudamerikas. Wiener Entomologische Zeitung, 42 (1 - 3), 33 - 38.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hesperus ferrugineus
Bernhauer 1925 : 36
. Type locality: Alta Gracia La Granja, Cordoba, Argentina. Type depository: FMNH HT. Distribution: Argentina. Notes: with
Acromyrmex aspersus
( Bruch 1929 ; Navarrete- Heredia 2001 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comment. Not
Hesperus
, to be placed in a further study; it probably belongs to the
Belonuchus
complex.

800–900m
